enWisdom: Conceit is the cornerstone of ignorance
Conceit is the most harmful associate

Wisdom: إِذَا زَادَ عُجْبُكَ بِمَا أَنْتَ فِيهِ مِنْ سُلْطَانِكَ فَحَدَثَتْ لَكَ أُبَّهَةٌ أَوْ مَخِيلَةٌ فَانْظُرْ إِلَى عِظَمِ مُلْكِ اللَّهِ وَقُدْرَتِهِ مِمَّا لَا تَقْدِرُ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ نَفْسِكَ فَإِنَّ ذَلِكَ يُلَيِّنُ مِنْ جَمَاحِكَ [مِنْ جَنَاحِكَ‏] وَيَكُفُّ عَنْ غَرْبِكَ وَيَفِي‏ءُ إِلَيْكَ بِمَا عَزَبَ عَنْكَ مِنْ عَقْلِكَ
enWisdom: When your self-importance is increased by the position [of authority] you are in, and this brings about arrogance or vanity in you, then look at the greatness of the authority of Allah and His power, the power which you do not even possess over yourself, for indeed this will mellow your recalcitrance, cure your vehemence and bring back to you that which had departed from you of your intellect

Wisdom: سَيِّئَةٌ تَسُوؤُكَ خَيْرٌ مِنْ حَسَنَةٍ تُعْجِبُكَ
enWisdom: The evil that befalls you is better than the good that makes you conceited

Wisdom: شَرُّ النَّاسِ مَنْ يَرَى أَنَّهُ خَيْرُهُمْ
enWisdom: The worst person is one who considers himself to be the best of them

Wisdom: كَفَى بِالْمَرْءِ رَذِيلَةً أَنْ يُعْجِبَ بِنَفْسِهِ
enWisdom: It is sufficient of a depravity for one to be pleased [and impressed] with himself

Wisdom: مَنْ كَانَ عِنْدَ نَفْسِهِ عَظِيماً كَانَ عِنْدَ اللَّهِ حَقِيراً
enWisdom: Whoever is great in his own eyes is low in the sight of Allah

Wisdom: مَنْ تَرَكَ الْعُجْبَ وَالتَّوَانِيَ لَمْ يَنْزِلْ بِهِ مَكْرُوهٌ
enWisdom: Adversity does not descend upon the one who abandons conceit and lassitude
Nothing damages [one’s] merits [and good deeds] like conceit

Wisdom: مَا لِابْنِ آدَمَ وَالْعُجْبِ وَأَوَّلُهُ نُطْفَةٌ مَذِرَةٌ وَآخِرُهُ جِيفَةٌ قَذِرَةٌ وَهُوَ بَيْنَ ذَلِكَ يَحْمِلُ الْعَذَرَةَ
enWisdom: What has the son of Adam to do with conceit? His beginning is foul semen and his end is a rotting corpse, and in between these he is a carrier of waste products
There is no alienation more desolating than conceit

Wisdom: لَا يَنْبَغِي لِمَنْ عَرَفَ اللَّهَ أَنْ يَتَعَاظَمَ
enWisdom: It does not behove one who knows Allah to become haughty
